headline: Looking At The Narrative For Salesforce CRM As AI And Valuation Assumptions Shift
summary: What Is Driving the Subtle Shift in Salesforce’s Valuation Narrative? Salesforce’s fair value estimate has been nudged from about US$329.65 to about US$327.86 and the discount rate used in the analysis has been adjusted slightly from about 8.57% to about 8.53%. This small reset reflects both ongoing optimism around growth drivers like artificial intelligence and a touch more caution in how that potential is being priced. Supportive voices still point to AI, improving key performance...

headline: Salesforce, Inc. (CRM): A Bull Case Theory
summary: We came across a bullish thesis on Salesforce, Inc. on Darius Dark Investing’s Substack. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on CRM. Salesforce, Inc.’s share was trading at $227.96 as of January 28th. CRM’s trailing and forward P/E were 30.51 and 17.51 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. Salesforce, Inc. (CRM) has fallen sharply out of favor as […]

headline: Salesforce Lands Major Army AI Deal As Valuation Discount Persists
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) has been awarded a 10 year, US$5.6b contract with the U.S. Army to deliver secure data and AI technologies. The deal is described as one of the largest government cloud and AI agreements to date, focused on federal digital modernization. Salesforce also launched EMBERPOINT, an AI driven public safety alliance with Lockheed Martin, PG&E, and Wells Fargo. EMBERPOINT aims to apply Salesforce’s AI agent platforms, autonomous tech, and data tools to wildfire prevention and...
